org.ensembl.driver
Interface EnsemblDriver

All Known Subinterfaces:
ComparaDriver, CoreDriver, Driver, VariationDriver
public interface EnsemblDriver

An ensembl driver provides access to an ensembl database through it's adaptors.

Author:
Craig Melsopp

Method Detail

initialise

public void initialise(java.util.Properties configuration)
                throws ConfigurationException,
                       AdaptorException
Initialises the driver and it's adaptor with the configuration.

Parameters:
configuration - parameters specifying the database and any additional datasource specific settings.
Throws:
ConfigurationException
AdaptorException

getConfiguration

public java.util.Properties getConfiguration()
Returns:
configuration provided to initialise(Properties) plus any locally made modifications.
See Also:
initialise(Properties)

getAdaptor

public Adaptor getAdaptor(java.lang.String type)
                   throws AdaptorException
Returns:
Adaptor of the specified type, or null if no such driver available.
Throws:
AdaptorException

getAdaptors

public Adaptor[] getAdaptors()
                      throws AdaptorException
Returns:
array of zero or more Adaptors.
Throws:
AdaptorException

testConnection

public boolean testConnection()
Checks whether a connection can be made to the database. Useful for checking if a driver has been correctly configured. Note: This method might leave an open connection in a connection pool so you should call closeAllConnections() if you want to ensure all connections are closed.

Returns:
true if driver can connect to it's persistent store, otherwise false.
See Also:
closeAllConnections()

isConnected

public boolean isConnected()
Deprecated. Since ensj 30.3. Use testConnection() instead.

Checks whether a connection can be made to the database. Useful for checking if a driver has been correctly configured. Note: This method might leave an open connection in a connection pool so you should call closeAllConnections() if you want to ensure all connections are closed.

Returns:
true if driver can connect to it's persistent store, otherwise false.
See Also:
closeAllConnections()

fetchDatabaseNames

public java.lang.String[] fetchDatabaseNames()
                                      throws AdaptorException
Lists databases available on this server. This method does not require the database or database_prefix to specified in the configuration. This means that you can connect to a database server and retrieve the database names without having to first know one of them.

Returns:
zero or more database names available on the same server as this driver instance.
Throws:
AdaptorException

addAdaptor

public Adaptor addAdaptor(Adaptor adaptor)
                   throws AdaptorException
Attempts to connects to the database if not already connected. Useful for checking if a driver has been correctly configured.

Returns:
true if driver can connect to it's persistent store, otherwise false.
Throws:
AdaptorException

public void clearAllCaches()
                    throws AdaptorException
Clears all caches.

Throws:

closeAllConnections

public void closeAllConnections()
                         throws AdaptorException

AdaptorException
